newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Total and Amoco make new Venezuela oil discovery.
newsitem.headline: Total and Amoco make new Venezuela oil discovery.

text.p: French oil company Total SA and U.S. company Amoco Corp have made another discovery of oil at the Jusepin field off northeastern Venezuela, Venezuelan state oil company Lagoven announced Friday.
According to Lagoven, the largest of Petroleos de Venezuela SA's (PDVSA) three main units, the new find has an initial flow of 8,500 barrels per day of 27 degree American Petroleum Institute crude.
It is the second discovery reported at the field which Total operates under a 20-year contract signed with Lagoven in November 1993.
Total announced in March a "significant discovery" of light crude at very deep levels.
"The new discovery confirms the high prospects of the area and opens the possibility of a rapid development of production from both wells in the short term," Lagoven said in a release.
According to Lagoven the Jusepin field has been drilled to over 5,750 meters (18,700 feet).
